entities

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractChar, Monster

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    The basic combat actor of this system. An Entity can either be controlled by the player or controlled by the computer, but it is what interacts directly with the combat system.

    This abstract class contains getter and setter methods for each of its protected variables, as well as .checkForDeath(). It also contains the two abstract (undefined) methods .die() and .attack().

    The protected variables housed in this class include every stat necessary for the combat system (HPmax, HP, strength, defense, and speed) , an array of the stat names (statNames), a simple boolean death value (dead), and a name String.

    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

      • checkForDeath

        public final void checkForDeath()
        This method checks if the entity has a current HP value that is less than or equal to 0, and if it does, it runs the .die() method. This is so that any entities that have "died" are removed from combat.
        See Also:
        die(ArrayList)

      • die

        public abstract void die(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
        This method removes the entity from combat in a way that differs depending on if it is a character or monster/NPC. If a monster dies, they are removed from combat with a simple statement and the monster's XP value is added to the party. If a character dies, (currently) the game will close.
        Parameters:
        actors - The encounter ArrayList
        See Also:
        checkForDeath()

      • act

        public abstract void act(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> encounter)
        The .act() method is how an Entity interacts with the combat system. Essentially, it encompasses what the Entity does on its turn.
        Parameters:
        encounter - the encounter the Entity is currently in.
        See Also:
        attack(Entity)

      • attack

        public abstract void attack(Entity other)
        This method makes the entity attack another Entity, which is the default option for monsters/NPCs.
        Parameters:
        other - the entity that is the target of the attack.
        See Also:
        act(ArrayList)
